### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 7b712e6</samp>

### Summary
🔀🛠️🚀

<!--
1.  🔀 - This emoji represents the git-sync-manager service, which is responsible for syncing the changes between the amplication server and the git repositories. It also implies that the service handles merging, branching, and resolving conflicts.
2.  🛠️ - This emoji represents the refactor and improvement of the git integration, which is a major and complex task that involves fixing bugs, enhancing features, and optimizing performance.
3.  🚀 - This emoji represents the deployment and launch of the new service, which is a significant milestone and achievement for the amplication project. It also implies that the service is ready for use and testing by the users and contributors.
-->
Refactor and rename the service that syncs git repositories with amplication. Update the VS Code task to serve the new `git-sync-manager` service instead of the old `amplication-git-pull-request-service`.

> _`git-sync-manager`_
> _A new service for springtime_
> _Simplifies `git`_

> _a winter workaround_

comment.body:
> @overbit @mulygottlieb please take a look at this change. For the best of my knowledge, this DockerFile is only used locally and the change does not have impact on the production deployment, but I would need you to confirm that before we merge this change

@yuval-hazaz the Dockerfile is used to generate any container image, local and/or staging/production.
This approach was a possible one to avoid publishing the libraries before testing them.
We need to investigate if the latest nx will allow us to fully leverage it to automatically copy all the deps in build time (it would be ok when bundling but dsg is not)

issue.title: ⭐ Plugin: GitHub Codespaces
issue.body:
## Requirements:
1. The new plugin will be well documented with instructions and HowTos
2. A new base codespaces configuration file that will allow to run the generated service, and if selected the adminui application.
4. The plugin should leverage into the `docker-compose.yml` file created by `CreateServerDockerCompose` event instead of redefining new rules
5. The plugin settings will contain a property that will allow the user to define a custom location for `devcontainer.json`. The default value for this setting should be `<repo-root-dir>/.devcontainer/devcontainer.json`
6. The plugin settings will contain a property that will allow the user to generate the configuration based on the service name. When this setting is `true` the configuration location will be set as  `<repo-root-dir>/.devcontainer/<service-name>/devcontainer.json`
7. The plugin will contains unit tests to cover the expected scenarios

## Icon
![GitHub Codespaces](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/assets/112330500/d934c39a-270b-4606-80d6-b313e3d164d6)

## Prize: USD 200 🏆 

Reply with the proposed solutions and structures.

pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Amplication :)

PLEASE, GO THROUGH THESE STEPS BEFORE SUBMITTING A PR!

Make sure that:

1. There is an open issue for this PR. If not, please open one before submitting your changes. Before proceeding, any change needs to be discussed (You can skip this if you're fixing a typo or adding an app to the Showcase).
2. You have done your changes in a separate branch. Branches MUST have descriptive names that start with either the `fix/[issue #]-` or `feature/[issue #]-` prefixes. Good examples are: `fix/404-signin-issue` or `feature/201-new-templates`.
3. You are giving a descriptive title to your PR following CONTRIBUTING.md conventions
4. You are providing enough information about your changes for others to review your pull request.
5. Ensure the PR is targeting `next` branch

-->

Close: https://github.com/amplication/amplication/issues/7339

issue.title: 📖 Documentation: Update Repository to Reflect Twitter's New Name
issue.body: ### Description (What is it?) Twitter has undergone a name change and is now known as "X." To ensure the repository accurately reflects this update, I'm opening this issue and creating a related pull request (PR). ### Use Case (Why does the user need it?) It serves as a visual tool to engage and inform the user's audience about the new Twitter name (X). ### Issue URL None ### Pull Request URL _No response_ ### How it works (How does the user use it?) issue.title: Build Web Apps Using Amplication 👕
issue.body:
###  Contribute a Tutorial & Grab an Amplication T-Shirt! 🎉

**Starting October 1, 2023**

Hello Amplication Enthusiasts! 🌟

We are excited to announce a special initiative for our vibrant community. We are inviting all of you to create a web application using Amplication and share your journey through a detailed tutorial or a video walkthrough. Each participant, upon approval and submission, will receive an exclusive Amplication T-shirt!

**How to Participate?**
1. Propose your application idea by commenting below or directly reaching out to our team for approval.
2. Once approved, build your application using Amplication.
3. Craft a detailed tutorial explaining the process or create a video walkthrough. Ensure clarity, comprehensiveness, and creativity.
4. Post the tutorial on the blog/video-sharing platform of your choice.
5. Submit a PR with the tutorial link to `amplication/amplication/tutorials/filename`
6. Once approved, your tutorial will be featured on our official channels, and you'll receive your T-shirt!

**Need Ideas? Here are some to get you started:**
1. Personal Expense Tracker
2. Online Quiz Platform
3. Event Management System
4. Book Review Portal
5. Fitness Routine Planner
7. Recipe Sharing Application
8. Real Estate Listing Portal
9. Virtual Classroom Management
10. Local Services Directory
11. Blogging Platform

Of course, these are just suggestions. We're eager to see the innovative ideas you come up with. The sky's the limit!

**Community Examples**

- Build an AirBnB clone using Amplication: https://youtu.be/nkmPmUpUM6U?si=heeaZ_HvPOdh4_KE
- Building a Real-time Chatroom using Amplication: https://amplication.com/blog/creating-a-chatroom-in-angular-using-amplication

**Guidelines:**
- The idea should be unique and not replicate existing tutorials or samples.
- The content should be original and not violate any copyright rules.
- Make sure the tutorial is detailed, with screenshots or video sections clearly showcasing each step.
- Ensure your app doesn't promote any form of hate, discrimination, or anything that violates Amplication's community guidelines.

Looking forward to seeing the amazing applications and tutorials you all create! Let's learn, share, and grow together! 🚀

pull_request.title: feat(client):module actions
pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Amplication :)

PLEASE, GO THROUGH THESE STEPS BEFORE SUBMITTING A PR!

Make sure that:

1. There is an open issue for this PR. If not, please open one before submitting your changes. Before proceeding, any change needs to be discussed (You can skip this if you're fixing a typo or adding an app to the Showcase).
2. You have done your changes in a separate branch. Branches MUST have descriptive names that start with either the `fix/[issue #]-` or `feature/[issue #]-` prefixes. Good examples are: `fix/404-signin-issue` or `feature/201-new-templates`.
3. You are giving a descriptive title to your PR following CONTRIBUTING.md conventions
4. You are providing enough information about your changes for others to review your pull request.
5. Ensure the PR is targeting `next` branch

-->

Close: #[issue-number]

## PR Details

<!-- Explain the details for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

<!--
copilot:all
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 1135c9e</samp>

### Summary
🚀🛠️📝

<!--
1.  🚀 - This emoji represents the updates to the workflows and the Docker image, which improve the performance, reliability, and deployment of the project.
2.  🛠️ - This emoji represents the updates to the configuration files, such as `devcontainer.json`, `jest.config.ts`, `.eslintrc.json`, and `project.json`, which fix some issues, simplify some options, and migrate to the latest Nx plugins and rules.
3.  📝 - This emoji represents the updates to the documentation files, such as `PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md`, `CONTRIBUTING.md`, and `README.md`, which improve the clarity, accuracy, and completeness of the information for developers and contributors.
-->
This pull request updates various configuration files, workflows, and documentation files to migrate to the latest version of Nx, improve the code quality and consistency, and simplify the development and release workflows. It also deletes an unused file and fixes some minor formatting issues.

> _Sing, O Muse, of the mighty pull request_
> _That updated the `devcontainer` and `ci` files_
> _And made the `jest` and `eslint` configs more correct_
> _With the help of the latest `Nx` tools and styles_

### Walkthrough
*  Update the `devcontainer.json` file to use a newer version of the `typescript-node` image ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-24ad71c8613ddcf6fd23818cb3bb477a1fb6d83af4550b0bad43099813088686L4-R4))
*  Migrate to the latest version of Nx, which simplifies the plugin names and changes the configuration for Jest, webpack, and eslint ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6884918dc8291219be508e05e28965b958c734def85324f3b53858ea4702090fL4-R4), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6884918dc8291219be508e05e28965b958c734def85324f3b53858ea4702090fL43-R53), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-2300b6b0abb58ce968c649c14f4522d19168b6fed5a12293f54e7c713c49d805L5-R13), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-49ecfdc98257536a49cf2ef8a8c8946b48403fdec48011812c256e941725f361L8-R8), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-49ecfdc98257536a49cf2ef8a8c8946b48403fdec48011812c256e941725f361L15-R15), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-49ecfdc98257536a49cf2ef8a8c8946b48403fdec48011812c256e941725f361L25-R25), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-49ecfdc98257536a49cf2ef8a8c8946b48403fdec48011812c256e941725f361L39-R41), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-97e84fab7a8d39d5ac0654aa1e1bea22e5e5ca5f9ed52ba5548dd2505e751e87L5-R13), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fa6a1e9b79dd8dcc65758f695c9497783dc00cf86027eb9604c74604a3c26f49L9-R9), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fa6a1e9b79dd8dcc65758f695c9497783dc00cf86027eb9604c74604a3c26f49L18-R18), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fa6a1e9b79dd8dcc65758f695c9497783dc00cf86027eb9604c74604a3c26f49L28-R28), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fa6a1e9b79dd8dcc65758f695c9497783dc00cf86027eb9604c74604a3c26f49L51-R53), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fa6a1e9b79dd8dcc65758f695c9497783dc00cf86027eb9604c74604a3c26f49L62-R64), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-ef9ce7e3aba7b87033ed4dfa3f1a50078ea380aa24afbe0d6e745d385bcee63bL5-R12), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-7827c6f189e8b8838d5c162e4125e022e0311f242d00eb309e1d4c9050abb18bL8-R8), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-7827c6f189e8b8838d5c162e4125e022e0311f242d00eb309e1d4c9050abb18bL15-R15), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-7827c6f189e8b8838d5c162e4125e022e0311f242d00eb309e1d4c9050abb18bL22-R22), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-7827c6f189e8b8838d5c162e4125e022e0311f242d00eb309e1d4c9050abb18bL28-R30), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-7827c6f189e8b8838d5c162e4125e022e0311f242d00eb309e1d4c9050abb18bL39-R41))
*  Remove unnecessary and redundant steps for caching node modules and Cypress binary in the GitHub workflows, using the `actions/setup-node@v3` step instead ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fL63-R64), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b177247829708ad66612367c4c0d4dda496e1b1838aca6b43a095ce9bae80431L56-R56), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3e103440521ada06efd263ae09b259e5507e4b8f7408308dc227621ad9efa31eL39), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3e103440521ada06efd263ae09b259e5507e4b8f7408308dc227621ad9efa31eL78-R78), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-a2765f0b0f4f04930dda074571e9f5477116139d7b151bd33d9029fc65812559L49), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-d71a685d649ba24b32b56754d3bb8cdbdb57c14447b3d2f531ae8a383d24307aL44))
*  Change the logic for creating the `NEW_TAG` variable in the `release.dsg.production.yml` file, using the `version` input from the user and checking if it matches the `package.json` version ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-51fcfb90d295dbd552e9d5728a5b1d1229730d83289a9505cd3b64379f4bf319L50-R57))
*  Add some new steps for setting up the node environment and caching the node modules in the `release.dsg.production.yml` file, using the `actions/setup-node@v3` step ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-51fcfb90d295dbd552e9d5728a5b1d1229730d83289a9505cd3b64379f4bf319R137-R155))
*  Add a new environment variable `PRODUCTION_TAGS` to the `deploy:container` target in the `release.dsg.production.yml` file, to indicate that the Docker image should be tagged with the production version and pushed to the registry ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-51fcfb90d295dbd552e9d5728a5b1d1229730d83289a9505cd3b64379f4bf319R176))
*  Change the commands for getting the affected applications and updating the version of the applications in the `release.production.yml` file, using the `npx nx show projects` and the `npx nx run-many` commands instead of the `npx nx print-affected` and the `npx nx affected` commands ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-01085e43c580feab2b4853d3f444ec18378cb427dbf2590633938157ad97c773L93-R95), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-01085e43c580feab2b4853d3f444ec18378cb427dbf2590633938157ad97c773L118-R118))
*  Add a new requirement for the pull request title to follow the `CONTRIBUTING.md` conventions in the `PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md` file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-18813c86948efc57e661623d7ba48ff94325c9b5421ec9177f724922dd553a35L9-R12))
*  Add some new instructions for forking and cloning the repository, installing TypeScript globally, checking the node and npm versions, and having Docker installed and running in the `README.md` file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L60-R65), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L69-R72), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L113-R121))
*  Add a new instruction for creating a branch with the `chore` prefix in the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L88-R83))
*  Add a new instruction for creating a pull request targeting the `next` branch and following the same format as the commit messages in the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L129-R121))
*  Extend the `plugin:storybook/recommended` rules in the `.eslintrc.json` file, to enforce best practices for writing stories for Storybook ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6884918dc8291219be508e05e28965b958c734def85324f3b53858ea4702090fL43-R53))
*  Add a new override for `*.json` files in the `.eslintrc.json` file, to use the `jsonc-eslint-parser` and the `@nx/dependency-checks` rule, which ensures that the dependencies in the `package.json` files are consistent and up-to-date ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6884918dc8291219be508e05e28965b958c734def85324f3b53858ea4702090fL43-R53))
*  Remove some extra spaces at the end of the `MAX_SNAPSHOTS` and `GIT_DEFAULT_ORIGIN_NAME` lines in the `.env` file in the `amplication-git-pull-service` package ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e51f0cb0299b367482a7e345c96e76e0f4998f9e9c188bf81aa17a91ae6661ecL29-R29))
*  Fix some typos and grammatical errors in the `README.md` and `CONTRIBUTING.md` files ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L42-R42), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L90-R90), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L96-R96), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L122-R127), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L163-R170), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L184-R193), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L105-R95), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L113-R103), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-eca12c0a30e25b4b46522ebf89465a03ba72a03f540796c979137931d8f92055L121-R111))
*  Delete the `.storybook/main.ts` file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7303/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-2d9ab5214985b9a608b4cd47ed561a301cfd4c7d5352c7a94ee046d4e1f1af10))



## PR Checklist

- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added
- [ ] `npm test` doesn't throw any error

IMPORTANT: Please review the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file for detailed contributing guidelines.

pull_request.title: feat(dsg): Module action types
pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Amplication :)

PLEASE, GO THROUGH THESE STEPS BEFORE SUBMITTING A PR!

Make sure that:

1. There is an open issue for this PR. If not, please open one before submitting your changes. Before proceeding, any change needs to be discussed (You can skip this if you're fixing a typo or adding an app to the Showcase).
2. You have done your changes in a separate branch. Branches MUST have descriptive names that start with either the `fix/[issue #]-` or `feature/[issue #]-` prefixes. Good examples are: `fix/404-signin-issue` or `feature/201-new-templates`.
3. You are giving a descriptive title to your PR following CONTRIBUTING.md conventions
4. You are providing enough information about your changes for others to review your pull request.
5. Ensure the PR is targeting `next` branch

-->

Close: #[issue-number]

## PR Details

<!-- Explain the details for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

<!--
copilot:all
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at b708091</samp>

### Summary
📝🚀🛠️

<!--
1.  📝 - This emoji represents the creation of a new file test-data that exports a common test data object. It also represents the refactoring of several test files to use this object and reduce code duplication.
2.  🚀 - This emoji represents the enhancement of the data service generator to support module actions and containers for data service resources. It also represents the introduction of new types and exports for code generation of modules and actions for entities.
3.  🛠️ - This emoji represents the enhancement of the build service and the moduleAction service to include module actions and containers in the data service generation process. It also represents the use of external packages and utility functions to simplify the logic for creating and executing module actions.
-->
This pull request adds support for generating data services with module actions and containers, which are custom logic and UI components for app modules. It introduces new types and functions in the code-gen-types and dsg-utils packages, and updates the build and moduleAction services to use them. It also refactors the data-service-generator tests to use a shared test data object.

> _To generate data services with ease_
> _We added some modules and actions, you see_
> _We used types and utils_
> _From external packages and tools_
> _And shared `TEST_DATA` to avoid duplicity_

### Walkthrough
*  Add types and functions for entity actions and modules to the code-gen-types and dsg-utils packages ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-48fce0786671bd35c0769a214ab7d452b005cb280f0038c889f46d42f15a2bd0R12),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-48fce0786671bd35c0769a214ab7d452b005cb280f0038c889f46d42f15a2bd0R282-R305),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3289fd186e391202af1128baed87cffaebdbcf96f61bbe7d5130dfef7fccb024R3-R8),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3289fd186e391202af1128baed87cffaebdbcf96f61bbe7d5130dfef7fccb024R19-R85))
*  Import and use the new types and functions in the data-service-generator package to prepare the context for generating a data service ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fb96372e0ef8e9fe598c88e8fa44b39ebb21fbdc4481e3cdb6acdfe7f3d2ad85R27-R28),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-fb96372e0ef8e9fe598c88e8fa44b39ebb21fbdc4481e3cdb6acdfe7f3d2ad85R72-R74),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93R10-R14),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93R27),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93R43-R44),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93R70-R75),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93R229-R269))
*  Import and use the new types and functions in the amplication-server package to handle the build process of an app and create the default module actions for each entity ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e443ab936d676c8ed3f34aecb9abab06a910e16b8da05261763e256755f7f54cR24-R25),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e443ab936d676c8ed3f34aecb9abab06a910e16b8da05261763e256755f7f54cR47-R48),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-0bd5f3f111abe353c918c42195a3ecfc287ced63e6debf18d4d0ddda5a49297aR28-R29),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-0bd5f3f111abe353c918c42195a3ecfc287ced63e6debf18d4d0ddda5a49297aR205-R206),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-0bd5f3f111abe353c918c42195a3ecfc287ced63e6debf18d4d0ddda5a49297aR837-R844),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-0bd5f3f111abe353c918c42195a3ecfc287ced63e6debf18d4d0ddda5a49297aR875-R876),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-92e2b918d73a37c09d11b002eb27716eb320ebca06c823a0c53e68d0a1280695L16-R19),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-92e2b918d73a37c09d11b002eb27716eb320ebca06c823a0c53e68d0a1280695L124-R153))
*  Update the tests for the `createDataService` function to use the common `TEST_DATA` object and include the `moduleActions` and `moduleContainers` properties ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-d69675551b9150759e8be16c37cfd7616a173a4b1046412fd05de569fceeab59L2-R5),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-d69675551b9150759e8be16c37cfd7616a173a4b1046412fd05de569fceeab59L35-R33),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-f8ad6e5bf05b13792da8006d1196bb7caa64560928e9d40d1ccb48a9ad974900L2-R8),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-f8ad6e5bf05b13792da8006d1196bb7caa64560928e9d40d1ccb48a9ad974900L32-R31),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-bbf851683ac7a4f550269a0f5542f805f4ba9621d15f1738d4b089b3c412c504L9-R10),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-bbf851683ac7a4f550269a0f5542f805f4ba9621d15f1738d4b089b3c412c504L41-R40),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6869038cc34da5f7eaaefc64c360abf490f421515cefd8b36fa269133943f48aL1-R5),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-6869038cc34da5f7eaaefc64c360abf490f421515cefd8b36fa269133943f48aL31-R29),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-12f12cefbb445cccb6f2c8437004b0e9b32ddc903a543e217a4f6c04f5075860L4-R5),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-12f12cefbb445cccb6f2c8437004b0e9b32ddc903a543e217a4f6c04f5075860L31-R29),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3384d83fef55cdf63d951b7b465b5fe620c6d93e06401286aecebc197fa7ab86L3-R4),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3384d83fef55cdf63d951b7b465b5fe620c6d93e06401286aecebc197fa7ab86L16-R13),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-545dae7086ad9616b72a173bc5d2258ba4de0516db7fa7dba361ba373ae22f1bR1-R17),[link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7304/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3f2a063de14588fbf23cc6430e18d40f7943f12c78006d20f21a86cd745323fdR109-R110))



## PR Checklist

- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added
- [ ] `npm test` doesn't throw any error

IMPORTANT: Please review the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file for detailed contributing guidelines.

pull_request.title: feat(dsg):update controller actions
pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Amplication :)

PLEASE, GO THROUGH THESE STEPS BEFORE SUBMITTING A PR!

Make sure that:

1. There is an open issue for this PR. If not, please open one before submitting your changes. Before proceeding, any change needs to be discussed (You can skip this if you're fixing a typo or adding an app to the Showcase).
2. You have done your changes in a separate branch. Branches MUST have descriptive names that start with either the `fix/[issue #]-` or `feature/[issue #]-` prefixes. Good examples are: `fix/404-signin-issue` or `feature/201-new-templates`.
3. You are giving a descriptive title to your PR following CONTRIBUTING.md conventions
4. You are providing enough information about your changes for others to review your pull request.
5. Ensure the PR is targeting `next` branch

-->

Close: #[issue-number]

## PR Details

<!-- Explain the details for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

<!--
copilot:all
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 4dd2e34</samp>

### Summary
🔄🆕🔐

<!--
1.  🔄 - This emoji represents the refactoring and reorganizing of the code and types to separate the concerns of data service generation and related field actions. It also implies the changes to the plugin interfaces to use the `entityActions` parameter.
2.  🆕 - This emoji represents the addition of new features and functionality, such as the `removeClassMethodByName` function, the `entityActions` type, and the generation of controller modules for custom actions.
3.  🔐 - This emoji represents the changes to the permissions logic and the `setEndpointPermissions` function, which now handles the case when a class method is removed by the `removeClassMethodByName` function. It also implies the security aspect of the custom actions and their permissions.
-->
This pull request adds support for custom actions on entities in the data service generator. It refactors some utility functions and types to handle the actions metadata and logic. It also updates the code generation plugins to use the new `entityActions` parameter. It modifies the controller modules to include the custom actions and remove the default actions if needed. It changes some types and functions in the `amplication-code-gen-types` and `util/dsg-utils` libraries.

> _`entityActions`_
> _More data for controllers_
> _Spring brings new features_

### Walkthrough
*  Move imports of pluralize and camelCase from `entity-util.ts` to `libs/util/dsg-utils/src/lib/entity-util.ts` and add imports of camelCase, pascalCase and pluralize to the latter file ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3289fd186e391202af1128baed87cffaebdbcf96f61bbe7d5130dfef7fccb024L1-L2), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3289fd186e391202af1128baed87cffaebdbcf96f61bbe7d5130dfef7fccb024L8-R8), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b70cc6953241628056e763082eab5683deb2de122b56e3dbb7ad3fb84c805256L1-L2), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b70cc6953241628056e763082eab5683deb2de122b56e3dbb7ad3fb84c805256L8-R8))
* Remove default actions for related fields from `getDefaultActionsForEntity` and handle them separately in `entityRelatedFieldDefaultActions` type ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3289fd186e391202af1128baed87cffaebdbcf96f61bbe7d5130dfef7fccb024L78-L83), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b70cc6953241628056e763082eab5683deb2de122b56e3dbb7ad3fb84c805256L82-L87))
* Change `entityDefaultActions` type to explicitly list possible actions and use `entityActions` type to include default, related and custom actions ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-48fce0786671bd35c0769a214ab7d452b005cb280f0038c889f46d42f15a2bd0L294-R318))
* Add `entityActions` parameter to `CreateEntityModulesParams`, `CreateEntityControllerParams` and `CreateEntityControllerBaseParams` interfaces to pass actions information to plugins ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-8ec1349510d73b28d516206efd7feaeaade54b394a928088f17e945bd9312ce3R11), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-8ec1349510d73b28d516206efd7feaeaade54b394a928088f17e945bd9312ce3R47), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-8ec1349510d73b28d516206efd7feaeaade54b394a928088f17e945bd9312ce3R58))
* Change return value of `prepareEntityActions` to include `entityActions` type ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93L245-R252), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-4620205caf74183bce62096003327131d1c6a31db5d610fbf9efc9c9d0207f93L266-R280))
* Import `ModuleAction` type and `removeClassMethodByName` function in `create-controller.ts` ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R24), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R36))
* Add `entityActionsMap` parameter to `createControllerModules` function and use `entityActions` variable to get actions information for current entity ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13L73-R75), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R81-R82))
* Use identifiers from `entityActions` variable instead of hard-coded strings for entity actions in `createControllerModules` function ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13L85-R103))
* Pass `entityActions` parameter to `createControllerBaseModule` and `setEndpointPermissions` functions and use it in template mapping ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R153), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R168), [link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R227))
* Remove class methods that correspond to disabled actions from class declaration node in `createControllerBaseModule` function using `removeClassMethodByName` function and `entityActions` parameter ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R297-R303))
* Remove unnecessary comments and declarations from template in `createControllerBaseModule` function using existing utility functions ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5d3523716919bd6ad8e6498d893c61c87ae7829c75b8d3656e889978b480ff13R310-R315))
* Return early if class method is not found in `setEndpointPermissions` function instead of throwing error, to handle case when method is removed by `removeClassMethodByName` function ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b4f0bece65d507054117c252462105e476d96cb8104dad0512ba3742dc529180L32-R32))
* Add `removeClassMethodByName` function to `ast.ts` to provide utility to remove class method by name from class declaration node ([link](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/pull/7307/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-95af8698da4339ab1eeb3d8707da727ed0bc613df9b446a3abeca4293c315f42R712-R739))



## PR Checklist

- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added
- [ ] `npm test` doesn't throw any error

IMPORTANT: Please review the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/amplication/amplication/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file for detailed contributing guidelines.
